Cmd0.Name: help
Cmd0.Desc1: Get help on the Console Commands
Cmd0.Arg1: No Argument or '-a' will display a list of Console commands
Cmd0.Arg2: Optional: '-v' will display a list of Console commands with their descriptions
Cmd0.Arg3: Optional: Command-name will display the command description

Cmd1.Desc1: Get help on the Console Commands
Cmd1.Arg1: No Argument, '-a', or '-all' will display a list of Console commands
Cmd1.Arg2: Optional: '-v' or '-verbose' will display a list of Console commands with their descriptions
Cmd1.Arg3: Optional: Command-name will display the command description

Cmd4.Name: getSystemConfig
Cmd4.Desc2: Can display all parmeters or a single parameter
Cmd4.Arg1: No Argument or 'all' will display all System Configuration parameters
Cmd4.Arg2: Optional: Parameter-name will display the System Configuration parameter

Cmd5.Name: setSystemConfig
Cmd5.Arg1: Required: Parameter-name is the parameter to be updated
Cmd5.Arg2: Required: Parameter-value is the parameter value

Cmd6.Name: getModuleTypeConfig
Cmd6.Desc2: Can display all Module Type parameters, parameters for a single module type , or a single parameter for a specific module type
Cmd6.Arg1: No Argument or 'all' will display all Module Type Configuration parameters
Cmd6.Arg2: Optional: Module-type will display the Module Type Configuration parameters
Cmd6.Arg3: Optional: Module-type and Parameter-name will display the Module Type Configuration parameter

Cmd7.Name: setModuleTypeConfig
Cmd7.Desc1: Set a Module Type Configuration parameter
Cmd7.Arg1: Required: Module-type is the parameter to be updated
Cmd7.Arg2: Required: Parameter-name is the parameter to be updated
Cmd7.Arg3: Required: Parameter-value is the parameter value

Cmd8.Name: getProcessConfig
Cmd8.Desc2: Can display all Process parameters, parameters for a single process, or a single parameter for a specific process
Cmd8.Arg1: No Argument or 'all' enter will display all Process Configuration parameters
Cmd8.Arg2: Optional: Process-name and Module-type will display the Process Configuration parameters
Cmd8.Arg3: Optional: Process-name, Module-type, and Parameter-name will display the Process Configuration parameter

Cmd9.Name: setProcessConfig
Cmd9.Arg1: Required: Process-name is the Process to be updated
Cmd9.Arg2: Required: Module-type is the Module Type of the Process to be updated
Cmd9.Arg3: Required: Parameter-name is the parameter to be updated
Cmd9.Arg4: Required: Parameter-value is the parameter value

Cmd10.Name: getAlarmConfig
Cmd10.Desc2: Can display all Alarms or a single Alarm
Cmd10.Arg1: No Argument or 'all' enter will display all Alarms Configuration parameters
Cmd10.Arg2: Optional: Alarm-ID will display the Alarm Configuration parameter

Cmd11.Name: setAlarmConfig
Cmd11.Arg1: Required: Alarm-ID is the Alarm to be updated
Cmd11.Arg2: Required: Parameter-name is the parameter to be updated
Cmd11.Arg3: Required: Parameter-value is the parameter value

Cmd12.Name: getActiveAlarms
Cmd12.Desc2: Displays all the Alarms that are currently active

Cmd13.Name: getStorageConfig
Cmd13.Desc2: Displays storage and dbroot assignment Information

Cmd14.Name: addDbroot
Cmd14.Desc1: Add DBRoot Disk storage to the InfiniDB System
Cmd14.Arg1: Required: Number of DBRoots to be added

Cmd15.Name: removeDbroot
Cmd15.Desc1: Remove DBRoot Disk storage from the InfiniDB System
Cmd15.Arg1: Required: List of Dbroot IDs to be removed

Cmd16.Name: stopSystem
Cmd16.Desc1: Stops the processing of the InfiniDB System
Cmd16.Desc2: It will leave the Modules powered on and the Operating Systems enable
Cmd16.Desc3: This command might be used for Software Maintenance reasons
Cmd16.Arg1: Optional: GRACEFUL/FORCEFUL is the mode the process will be taken down. Default is FORCEFUL
Cmd16.Arg2: Optional: ACK_YES/ACK_NO is Acknowledgment response or not. Default is ACK_YES

Cmd17.Name: shutdownSystem
Cmd17.Desc2: This command stops the processing of applications on all Modules within the InfiniDB System
Cmd17.Desc3: It should be using when performing an upgrade
Cmd17.Arg1: Optional: GRACEFUL/FORCEFUL is the mode the process will be taken down. Default is FORCEFUL
Cmd17.Arg2: Optional: ACK_YES/ACK_NO is Acknowledgment response or not. Default is ACK_YES

Cmd18.Name: startSystem
Cmd18.Desc1: Starts a stopped or shutdown InfiniDB System
Cmd18.Desc2: If system is shutdown, then a server root password should be entered if a ssh key is not defined

Cmd19.Name: restartSystem
Cmd19.Desc1: Restarts a stopped or shutdown InfiniDB System
Cmd19.Desc2: If system is shutdown, then a server root password should be entered if a ssh key is not defined
Cmd19.Arg1: Optional: GRACEFUL/FORCEFUL is the mode the process will be taken down. Default is FORCEFUL
Cmd19.Arg2: Optional: ACK_YES/ACK_NO is Acknowledgment response or not. Default is ACK_YES

Cmd20.Name: getSystemStatus
Cmd20.Desc2: Get Status of the InfiniDB System and the modules within the InfiniDB Appliance

Cmd21.Name: getProcessStatus
Cmd21.Desc2: Get Status of the InfiniDB Processes witin the InfiniDB System

Cmd23.Name: getAlarmHistory
Cmd23.Desc2: Get all set and clear alarms reported on the system on a daily basis
Cmd23.Arg1: Required: Date to Display in format of MM/DD/YY

Cmd25.Name: resetAlarm
Cmd25.Desc2: Resetting the Alarm will remove it from the Active Alarm Log file
Cmd25.Arg1: Required: AlarmID or ALL to reset all active alarms
Cmd25.Arg2: Required: Reporting Module or ALL to reset all active AlarmID alarms
Cmd25.Arg3: Required: Reported Device or ALL to reset all active AlarmID/Reporting Module Alarms

Cmd26.Name: enableLog
Cmd26.Desc1: Enable the levels of process and debug logging
Cmd26.Arg1: Required: 'system' or Module-name where logging is being enabled
Cmd26.Arg2: Required: 'all' or the specific level to enable
Cmd26.Arg3: Levels: critical, error, warning, info, and debug

Cmd27.Name: disableLog
Cmd27.Desc1: Disable the levels of process and debug logging
Cmd27.Arg1: Required: 'system' or Module-name where logging is being disabled
Cmd27.Arg2: Required: 'all' or the specific level to disable
Cmd27.Arg3: Levels: critical, error, warning, info, and debug

Cmd28.Name: switchParentOAMModule
Cmd28.Desc1: Switches the Active Parent OAM Module to another Performance Module
Cmd28.Desc2: A System stop and start is performed as part of the process
Cmd28.Desc3: Command is recommended to be done while the system is idle
Cmd28.Arg1: Optional: Performance-Module-name to switch to, default to Standby Parent OAM Module

Cmd29.Name: getStorageStatus
Cmd29.Desc2: Get Status of the InfiniDB DBRoot Storages within the InfiniDB Appliance
Only Valid for External Configured disk

Cmd30.Name: getLogConfig
Cmd30.Desc1: Get the System log file configuration
Cmd30.Desc2: Get the process and debug log file configuration on each Module

Cmd31.Name: movePmDbrootConfig
Cmd31.Desc1: Move DBroots from one Performance Module to another
Cmd31.Desc2: This command would be used before a Performance Module is removed or added
Cmd31.Arg1: Required: Performance Module Name where the Dbroot are being moved from
Cmd31.Arg2: Required: List of Dbroot IDs to be moved
Cmd31.Arg3: Required: Performance Module Name where the Dbroot are being moved to

Cmd32.Name: suspendDatabaseWrites
Cmd32.Desc1: Suspend performing writes to the InfiniDB Database

Cmd33.Name: resumeDatabaseWrites
Cmd33.Desc1: Resume performing writes to the InfiniDB Database

Cmd35.Name: assignDbrootPmConfig
Cmd35.Desc1: Assign unassigned DBroots to Performance Module
Cmd35.Desc2: This command could be used after a Performance Module and/or DBRoot is added
Cmd35.Arg1: Required: List of Dbroot IDs to be assigned

Cmd36.Name: getAlarmSummary
Cmd36.Desc1: Get Summary counts of Active Alarm

Cmd37.Name: getSystemInfo
Cmd37.Desc2: Get the System, Module, Process, and Active Alarm Statuses

Cmd38.Name: getModuleConfig
Cmd38.Desc2: Can display all Module Name parameters, parameters for a single module name, or a single parameter for a specific module name
Cmd38.Arg1: No Argument or 'all' will display all Module Name Configuration parameters
Cmd38.Arg2: Optional: Module-name will display the Module Name Configuration parameters
Cmd38.Arg3: Optional: Module-name and Parameter-name will display the Module Name Configuration parameter

Cmd39.Name: addExternalDevice
Cmd39.Desc1: Add External Device to Configuration file
Cmd39.Desc2: External Devices will be monitored and alarms reported on failures

Cmd40.Name: getExternalDeviceConfig
Cmd40.Desc2: Can display all External Device parameters or a single External Device
Cmd40.Arg1: No Argument or 'all' will display all External Devices Configuration parameters
Cmd40.Arg2: Optional: External Device name will display the Switch Name Configuration parameters

Cmd41.Name: setExternalDeviceConfig
Cmd41.Desc1: Set a External Device Configuration parameter
Cmd41.Arg1: Required: External-device-name is the parameter to be updated
Cmd41.Arg2: Required: Parameter-name is the parameter to be updated
Cmd41.Arg3: Required: Parameter-value is the parameter value

Cmd42.Name: removeExternalDevice
Cmd42.Desc1: Remove External Device to Configuration file

Cmd43.Name: assignElasticIPAddress
Cmd43.Desc1: Assign Amazon Elastic IP Address to a module

Cmd45.Name: getSystemNetworkConfig
Cmd45.Desc2: Displays the Network Host Names and IP Addresses for all Modules, Switches,
Cmd45.Desc3: and Storage Units that make up the system

Cmd47.Name: getCalpontSoftwareInfo
Cmd47.Desc1: Get the InfiniDB RPM detailed information

Cmd48.Name: addModule
Cmd48.Desc1: Add a Module within the InfiniDB System
Cmd48.Desc2: This command is used to configure a Module to the Configuration
Cmd48.Desc3: Database within the InfiniDB System. It will also install the
Cmd48.Desc4: InfiniDB Packages and setup the module to make it ready to be restored
Cmd48.Arg1: Required: Module-type or Module-name being added
Cmd48.Arg2: Required: Number-of-Modules being added when Module-type is specified

Cmd49.Name: removeModule
Cmd49.Desc1: Remove a Module within the InfiniDB System
Cmd49.Desc2: This command is used to unconfigure a Module from the Configuration
Cmd49.Arg1: Required: Module-type or Module-name being removed
Cmd49.Arg2: Required: Number-of-Modules being remove when Module-type is specified

Cmd52.Name: getModuleCpuUsers
Cmd52.Desc1: Get a Module Top Processes utilizing CPU
Cmd52.Desc2: The top number of processes using more than 0% will be displayed
Cmd52.Arg2: Optional: Top number of Process to Display (1-10, default is 5)

Cmd53.Name: getSystemCpuUsers
Cmd53.Desc1: Get System Top Processes utilizing CPU
Cmd53.Desc2: The top number of processes using more than 0% will be displayed
Cmd53.Arg1: Optional: Top number of Process to Display (1-10, default is 5)

Cmd54.Name: getModuleCpu
Cmd54.Desc2: The Modules CPU Usage percentage will be displayed

Cmd55.Name: getSystemCpu
Cmd55.Desc1: Get System CPU usage on all modules
Cmd55.Desc2: The System Modules CPU Usage percentage will be displayed

Cmd56.Name: getModuleMemoryUsers
Cmd56.Desc1: Get a Module Top Processes utilizing Memory
Cmd56.Desc2: The top number of processes using more than 0% will be displayed
Cmd56.Arg2: Optional: Top number of Process to Display (1-10, default is 5)

Cmd57.Name: getSystemMemoryUsers
Cmd57.Desc1: Get System Top Processes utilizing Memory
Cmd57.Desc2: The top number of processes using more than 0% will be displayed
Cmd57.Arg1: Optional: Top number of Process to Display (1-10, default is 5)

Cmd58.Name: getModuleMemory
Cmd58.Desc2: The Modules Memory Usage percentage will be displayed

Cmd59.Name: getSystemMemory
Cmd59.Desc1: Get System Memory usage on all modules
Cmd59.Desc2: The System Modules Memory Usage percentage will be displayed

Cmd60.Name: getModuleDisk
Cmd60.Desc2: The Modules Disk Usage will be displayed

Cmd61.Name: getSystemDisk
Cmd61.Desc1: Get System Disk usage on all modules
Cmd61.Desc2: The System Modules Disk Usage will be displayed

Cmd62.Name: getModuleResourceUsage
Cmd62.Desc2: The Modules Resource Usage will be displayed
Cmd62.Desc3: Resources consist of CPU, Memory, and Disk usage

Cmd63.Name: getSystemResourceUsage
Cmd63.Desc1: Get System Resource usage on all modules
Cmd63.Desc2: The System Modules Resource Usage will be displayed
Cmd63.Desc3: Resources consist of CPU, Memory, and Disk usage

Cmd64.Name: getActiveSQLStatements
Cmd64.Desc1: Get List Active SQL Statements within the System

Cmd65.Name: alterSystem-disableModule
Cmd65.Desc1: Disable a Module and Alter the InfiniDB System
Cmd65.Desc2: This command is used to place a Module in an disable state
Cmd65.Desc3: and restart the associated processes the InfiniDB System.

Cmd66.Name: alterSystem-enableModule
Cmd66.Desc1: Enable a Module and Alter the InfiniDB System
Cmd66.Desc2: This command is used to place a Module in an enable state
Cmd66.Desc3: and restart the associated processes the InfiniDB System.
